attributes.action: Make it against the law for dentists to turn away NHS patients of any age
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
If you look at this site:
http://www.nhs.uk/england/authoritiesTrusts/pct/showWithinPCT.aspx?pct=5QE&serviceID=1 you will see the problem. Most dentists now refuse NHS patients, children, the old aged, the infirm or just unemployed. 

As a medical profession this is a disgrace, what are these people to do for dental treatment? travel 80 or 90 miles to a practitioner who WILL treat them? Or take a credit card to pay the cost which can £40 to £80 per filling if not more in some areas. If they are on income support, incapacity benefits, disability etc then this may in itself not be possible at ALL.

Yet by simple legislation it could be made illegal for any practicing dentist in the UK to refuse to treat patients on the grounds that they are NHS.
